instance_template:
cpu("Ryzen9", 95; "i7", 85; "M1", 70).
gpu("RTX3070", 90; "RX6700XT", 88; "IrisXe", 65).
cooler("AirCool", 20; "LiquidCool", 40; "PassiveCool", 5).
high_perf("Ryzen9").

generator:
1 { selected_cpu(C) : cpu(C, _) } 1.
1 { selected_gpu(G) : gpu(G, _) } 1.
1 { selected_cooler(C) : cooler(C, _) } 1.

hard_constraints.description: Sanity check: if we're running a beast CPU, we gotta use liquid cooling or the whole thing's gonna melt.
Same deal for the GPU; don't try to skimp on cooling if you've got a high-end card in the slot.
Passive cooling is a total joke for discrete GPUs. Don't even try it.
Hardware mismatch alert! The M1 and that RX6700XT just don't play nice together.

soft_constraints.description: We want the beefiest specs possible, so let's max out that total performance score across the board.
soft_constraints.asp_rule:
total_perf(P) :- selected_cpu(C), cpu(C, P1), selected_gpu(G), gpu(G, P2), selected_cooler(K), cooler(K, P3), P = P1 + P2 + P3.
#maximize { P : total_perf(P) }.
